question: , Which required courses must be taken in ACTS 700x series?

context:
Program Name: Media Acting - Graduate Intensive
Code: P707
Credential: George Brown College Certificate
Method of Study: Full-time
Duration: 7 weeks
Starting Months: July
Domestic Tuition: $2,300.00*
Centre: Arts, Design & Information Technology
School: Media & Performing Arts
Location: St. James Campus
Required Courses:
- ACTS 7002: Creating Your Own Work
- ACTS 7006: Audition Techniques
- ACTS 7008: New Technology Acting
- ACTS 7009: Voice-over Characterization

Programs Offered: ACTS 7008 (New Technology Acting), ACTS 7009 (Voice-over Characterization), ACTS 7010 (Acting for the Camera), ACTS 7015 (Combat for Film), ACTS 7016 ( Commercial Auditioning), ACTS 7019 (Animation Voicing), ACTS 7050 (Guest Lecture Series)

Program Learning Outcomes: Ability to present oneself for employment as a professional actor, develop believable characters, convey and sustain character truth using technical skills, work collaboratively with industry professionals, and develop strategies for personal, career and professional growth.

Tuition & Fees: Domestic Tuition - $2,300.00 (subject to change), Additional Costs include materials, student service and ancillary fees. Financial Assistance is not available for this program.

Admission Requirements: Applicants must be a graduate of a two- or three-year Theatre Acting diploma or a three- or four-year BFA in acting or theatre professionals (Equity members). Applications are submitted directly to the School of Media and Performing Arts at George Brown College.

Contact Information: School of Media & Performing Arts, Phone: 416-415-5000, ext. 2015, Email: media@georgebrown.ca. For more general information about George Brown College, contact the Contact Centre at 416-415-2000.
